website_summaries.verdict: Hooray! One less dish to clean! No mess and no fuss way to strip cobs and collect kernels.
pros: This product has an interior blade that cuts off kernels
Container collects them as they fall
Works on either hot or cold corn
cons: Container holds a cup of kernels at a time
So it's best  for small meals, or be prepared to empty the container a few times

customer_reviews.title: Falls apart.
customer_reviews.text: I had 7 dozen ears of corn to freeze so I thought I'd try this product. Unfortunately, it didn't live up to Oxo's reputation...in my opinion. It comes in two pieces and snaps together for use but came apart so many times while using it that I just ended up used the blade part over a cookie sheet. Very frustrating. Unless I received a faulty one, I would not recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Fish

customer_reviews.title: Great gadget
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great. I don't try to get a whole cob's worth of kernels in it; best to dump at the halfway point. But it works really well and i'm very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: pat murphy

customer_reviews.title: Works OK with cooked corn, not so great with raw.
customer_reviews.text: Welp, I wanted it to work because getting the kernels off the cob with a chef's knife is a pain. But... while it works OK with cooked cobs, it really struggles with raw corn. Stripping the corn off the cob when raw is better done with a chef's knife and Rachel Ray's method... rest the bottom of the cob on the bottom of a small bowl set upside down inside a large one. This is the only Oxo product I have not been totally happy with.
customer_reviews.author: Hal Feinstein

customer_reviews.title: I don't get it
customer_reviews.text: The reviews were so glowing. This is one of very few OXO Good Grips products that just didn't fit my hand comfortably. Couldn't get enough pressure on cob to strip corn, just shaved it, but in the effort stabbed my other hand. A sharp knife is a much safer choice, at least for me. I've also had better luck with those propeller style strippers.
customer_reviews.author: Home Hunter 808

customer_reviews.title: Another great Oxo product
customer_reviews.text: I love, love, love Oxo products, and this is no exception. This is the second one that I bought; this one was for my mother. There were some issues with ability to eat corn on the cob, so this was my answer. Melt some butter, toss in the kernels, salt & pepper to taste and YUM!! Easy to use with the soft rubber sides, and cleaning is a breeze. Thanks again, Oxo!
customer_reviews.author: B. C. Preyer

customer_reviews.title: Easier to just use a knife
customer_reviews.text: It works but is very limited with the number of cobs that it will hold. It is good for one ear at a time. The person who recommended it said I could cut kernels off several ears at a time. Not so.Truthfully, I think it is just as easy to use a knife to cut off the kernels. The corn stripper is in the back of a drawer and will never be used again.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara R

customer_reviews.title: Great Corn Stripper for the Average Family
customer_reviews.text: Love this product. It arrived yesterday and I used it same day. It's easy to use, and easy to clean. I only need to strip 1 ear of corn, and the chamber did not fill up. If I had to strip 6 ears, I would simply dump the corn out of the chamber as needed by either inverting and shaking the corn out, or by opening the device which is pretty easy to do. It's so much safer than stripping corn from the cob with a knife, which is what I used to do before. Probably not the stripper of choice for a restaurant, bot works great for the average size family.
customer_reviews.author: pattijul

customer_reviews.title: leaves some kernals a little bit but still a great time and energy saver
customer_reviews.text: Works mostly well, leaves some kernals a little bit but still a great time and energy saver! I wish it came with a cover for the blade side cause its really sharp, i keep it in a small plastic container so no one gets hurt when going into the cabinets
customer_reviews.author: Aharv

customer_reviews.title: Fast and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I love love love this! We had several pounds of corn come from our first crop this year. I bought 3 different types of corn strippers and this is my favorite. You can cut yourself, mine were minor scratches, but after using it for a while I didn't have any issues. This is easy to use, and produces corn that is not mushy and great for canning. I like this much better than the old traditional style corn shucker and much better than the RSVP Shuck Deluxe Corn Stripper.
customer_reviews.author: christy gilmer

customer_reviews.title: Better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. At first I was a little skeptical at the quality of the product, but it was amazing. It was very efficient and easy to use. I would definitely recommend this product!!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this hoping to get a better strip of corn off the cob than I do with just a knife. It takes a bit to get the angle right, but once you do, this thing works pretty well. Not quite what I was expecting but for the price, it is way safer than using a butcher knife and my hand to strip ears of corn! I would definitely remind this item to a friend!
customer_reviews.author: J. McIntosh

customer_reviews.title: Has a curved blade that is better for getting full kernels off
customer_reviews.text: First and I mean first corn stripper to actually work. Has a curved blade that is better for getting full kernels off. Much tidier since the stripper itself catches the kernels. Worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Sheryl L.

customer_reviews.title: Does a good job!  Fast and less mess!
customer_reviews.text: I agree that the cutter is sharp. I nicked my fingers a couple of times before I figured out the best way to use it. After blanching and cooling the corn, hold the ear at one end and strip the corn from the middle to the other end all the way around. Turn the ear around and strip the other end of the corn. Starting in the middle keeps your fingers away from the cutter. This corn stripper does a very nice job and produces a lot less mess than the wooden strippers.
customer_reviews.author: Granny B

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product that made my life easier when freezing 15 dozen ears of sweet corn. How ever the grip could be easier to hold on to. But all around I LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Recommend
customer_reviews.text: As most oxo products this appears well built and verstile. Purchased over others bc can take a large to small cob as unit rests on outside. Go up and down outside of cob to remove pulp with handy container to catch all. About time something works and is up to my standards. As advertised and better.
customer_reviews.author: RV4RN

customer_reviews.title: Wish I'd bought this sooner!
customer_reviews.text: I have issues with hands and cutting corn off the cob can be very difficult, not to mention dangerous for me...but not anymore! OXO Good Grips line is wonderful, this corn stripper is the easiest and best one I've tried. It just takes a few passes to master, the cup makes what can be a messy job much neater and fast.
customer_reviews.author: Diana H.

customer_reviews.title: Strip Away On Raw Corn... Great!
customer_reviews.text: I was a "my bad" user the first time I tried this out. By the second time, cut the corn from the cob on 4 ears in less than 2 1/2 minutes, cleanly too! It works fastest and very clean cutting on raw corn; cooked or grilled ears, not as easy but doable. No sweat, highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: finyin

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I had to play around with the angle... But after the first ear, it worked very smoothely to remove the kernels...
customer_reviews.author: WildDandelion

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Love this product. So easy to use. Quickly strips an ear of corn without worrying about cutting yourself as with other kernel strippers
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Snow

customer_reviews.title: Nice little thing
customer_reviews.text: Got this on the America's Test Kitchen recommendation. It does work way better than my old corn stripper, although it does take some getting used to. Sometimes I shave it too high or too low.
customer_reviews.author: HeadintheClouds

customer_reviews.title: Strips a cob in seconds!
customer_reviews.text: Oh, to think I used a knife for all those years! You just run this stripper along the corn cob and the kernels come right off. It is great. And then it comes apart for easy cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: MissMartha

customer_reviews.title: Works great, no splatter
customer_reviews.text: This is the first corn stripper I've ever had and I love it! Works perfectly. I used to use a knife and this is great, no splatter.
customer_reviews.author: MaryLee

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: i tried a few different types of corn cob strippers and this is the best! it catches the kernels, is easy to press into the cob to get all the corn kernel out and easy comes apart to wash and pour out the kernels. it's dishwasher safe which is awesome. i used this on over 75 ears of corn this summer to make canned corn and creamed corn and had no problem.
customer_reviews.author: S. Joyce

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing!
customer_reviews.text: Works great and so easy to use + washes in the dishwasher. Only negatives are that the capacity isn't large enough for a full cob so it needs emptying and then reassembling and that the corn kinda sticks to the inside but it slides and cuts really well so it's worth it!
customer_reviews.author: JacksTacitSorrow

customer_reviews.title: So easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: Love this corn stripper! I have been canning my garden's abundance of corn and have done about 60 pints. This corn stripper really does the job well without flinging corn all over the room as it did when just using a knife. This corn stripper has earned a permanent spot in my kitchen and in my canning supplies!
customer_reviews.author: Rustic Magnolia

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work any better than a knife and bowl. Too slow for corn chowder.
customer_reviews.author: Jean B

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and clean
customer_reviews.text: I love corn on the cob but hate to have corn stuck in my teeth. This little device works wonderfully to cut the corn off of the cob and then cook the way you want it. It gives you full kernels and even if you don't align correctly and get some that are not full kernel, cooking them with the others just makes more flavor. Wonderful!!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: It's difficult to hold onto. Corn kernels fly everywhere when you use it. As nifty as it looks, it's design needs work. The hole at the top is way to big so the corn bounces right out of it as you slide it down the cob.
customer_reviews.author: Rhynian M. Zhahandi

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to use.
customer_reviews.text: Did not work as expected. I ended up making cream corn since most of the kernels broke or got mushed. A knife may have been easier.
customer_reviews.author: 🐼

customer_reviews.title: helpful
customer_reviews.text: I use it without plastic top since I find it difficult to put on and take off-otherwise fine and helpful to strip corn from cob-easier to cook corn rather than cooking with cob
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Does the job, nice product
customer_reviews.text: Does the job, still a little messy, but better than anything else I have found
customer_reviews.author: Mariella Ross

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected - one caveat...
customer_reviews.text: The Oxo Corn stripper is well-made and is fairly easy to use. It works fast and does an adequate job for those who don't like eating the corn on the cob. If you do not hold it correctly, however, it can come apart and spill the kernels. Also, there is the sharp cutter side which one has to be careful of. I would recommend this item, however, because it does the job.
customer_reviews.author: W. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: It is nice but only holds about a cup or less
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Muritz

customer_reviews.title: Awesome device. On my first use I stripped five ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome device. On my first use I stripped five ears of grilled corn in less than a minute with very little mess. So much better than doing it with a chef's knife. I will no longer look at corn hash recipes with dread.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Corn-off-the-cob the fast and easy way!
customer_reviews.text: The Oxo corn stripper made short work of my leftover grilled corn-on-the-cob. It was a quick and neat way to get corn off the cob and into freezer bags so we can enjoy it this winter. Other than a minor nick to a finger that got in the way, this tool did a wonderful job, and I would recommend it. Just keep those fingers out of the way!
customer_reviews.author: D. Walton

customer_reviews.title: WONDERFUL
customer_reviews.text: This worked better than I hoped. The mess was minimal (VERY minimal), which made cleaning up a breeze. I had some fat ears so I had to empty it before I was done. One suggestion is to leave a little bit of the stem on the bottom. I found that I wasn't getting all of the corn unless I was able to do it at an angle.
customer_reviews.author: Judy Priestley

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says on the box
customer_reviews.text: I finally got over using a knife to do this simple task when I almost cut myself, SO I looked online for a better solution. This is easy, compact, easy to clean and gets the job done. I do wish it got all the tips of the corn, but I think it's a pipe dream and that I'm clearly just obsessed with corn. Awesome product!
customer_reviews.author: M.V.

customer_reviews.title: I love to strip fresh corn to eat and freeze
customer_reviews.text: I love to strip fresh corn to eat and freeze. This is by far the easiest and less messy way to accomplish strip corn. Wish I would have found this sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Blue nun 77

customer_reviews.title: LOVE Easy to use and clean
customer_reviews.text: LOVE Easy to use and clean. Does a great job with little mess.
customer_reviews.author: Janis C. Wright

customer_reviews.title: Made my job easy!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to strip 16 dozen ears of corn. It worked great!
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: It does have a bit of a learning curve, but works ok.
customer_reviews.author: Nanias

customer_reviews.title: Great idea, and I used it for a while ...
customer_reviews.text: Great idea, and I used it for a while but I went back to the knife, it seems to get larger pieces and it's easier to milk the corn ~
customer_reviews.author: Captcha

customer_reviews.title: Maybe we are using it wrong?
customer_reviews.text: I love OXO and frequently purchase their items for my mom, who suffers with arthritis. When I bought this, I think she grated her fingers/knuckles more than the corn. So maybe we are using it wrong? ... not sure, but she doesn't use this anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Catlyn

customer_reviews.title: BEST CORN STRIPPER
customer_reviews.text: This is the best corn stripper I've ever used. But be careful. I found out the hard way. The blades are extremely sharp. This will strip about one ear and it's full. And then can be emptied into whatever container you plan to use.
customer_reviews.author: mgturbo1

customer_reviews.title: Best corn stripper on the market!
customer_reviews.text: It is ergonomically designed to fit in your hand and is easy to use. I love the way it collects the corn kernels inside as it keeps things from getting messy. I would recommend this to everyone who wants to make stripping your ears of corn an easy process.
customer_reviews.author: Saundra Sno' Mercado

customer_reviews.title: Safer than a knife.
customer_reviews.text: Works pretty good. A knife gets dangerous when you have a lot of corn to cut and this was a safer bet. I don't know if it was FASTER than the knife, but if you use it right you are protected somewhat from the blade.
customer_reviews.author: J Griffin

customer_reviews.title: Strips the corn, but doesn't catch well
customer_reviews.text: The main reason I bought this product was to avoid having flying corn everywhere as I cut the corn off the cob with a knife. The corn stripper does get the corn off the cob pretty well, but catching the corn is iffy. It catches most of the corn, but there is still corn that escapes. The clear, curved plastic part comes off easily during stripping. Maybe it's my form rather than the device, but it's still frustrating. Overall, there is less mess than cutting with a knife, but don't expect it to be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Mel B

customer_reviews.title: WORKS AS STATED
customer_reviews.text: WORKS GOOD ONCE YOU GET THE HANG OF IT MADE SHORT WORK OF DEKEARNELING 2 DOZ EARS OF CORN!
customer_reviews.author: robin

customer_reviews.title: Where have you been all my life?
customer_reviews.text: Where have you been all my life. I am not one of the lucky denture wearers that can eat corn off the cob. Had been using a knife. What an idiot. This is so easy. Love it
customer_reviews.author: Christine R

customer_reviews.title: Perfect unitasker
customer_reviews.text: works great to make a fresh corn salad and other uses for fresh corn. My husband laughed at me for buying it till he saw it in action.
customer_reviews.author: Carmel

customer_reviews.title: Great Gadget!
customer_reviews.text: Loved this. The only problem was the cover dosesn't always stay one. But I actually just put the corn cobs in the hole of bundt pan and just use the sharp part to zip the corn off.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Ha! My husband said it wouldn't work, as ...
customer_reviews.text: Ha! My husband said it wouldn't work, as he had tried a couple different devices, but this one worked perfectly. We did 100 ears of corn for the freezer one weekend, and now it's his prized possession.
customer_reviews.author: Judy A. Tatum

customer_reviews.title: Bigger than I thought, I like it
customer_reviews.text: This is well built and designed. I like that it traps the corn in a 'holder', so that it doesn't go all over the floor. Works well. The teeth aren't incredible sharp, but get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: likeadeere

customer_reviews.title: THIS IS THE WAY TO DO CORN!
customer_reviews.text: We grow a lot of sweet corn and end up freezing some every year. We have used knives (leave a lot on the cob) and another stripper corn shoots all over the place. This one collects it in the cup. Actually was recommended by America's Test Kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: RobtEB

customer_reviews.title: Great for getting the kernels off the cob
customer_reviews.text: This works so well. It makes taking kernels off the corn cob so easy and fast!
customer_reviews.author: L. Wood

customer_reviews.title: Really a super cool gadget
customer_reviews.text: Really a super cool gadget, easy to use, but mind your fingers if corn is hot. I get compliments every time my guests see me using it! Works great and lets you enjoy fresh corn without the mess of eating it off the cobb.
customer_reviews.author: Mark D Fitzgerald

customer_reviews.title: This worked great every time
customer_reviews.text: Solved my problem with denture issues. This worked great every time. Had to re-heat corn in microwave after using this tool but it performed great and not found in stores. Taking it with me when travelling to msouthern location where corn on cob is still available.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: corn stripper
customer_reviews.text: This corn stripper does a good job--it takes a little getting used to because you have to hold the corn in one hand and use the stripper with the other. But it is far superior to using a knife and much less dangerous. I'm glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy K

customer_reviews.title: dangerous
customer_reviews.text: You shouldn't buy it unless you like bloody stumps. Buy it if you have invested in band-aids because you will need quite a few.
customer_reviews.author: MP

customer_reviews.title: Makes stripping corn east
customer_reviews.text: This product is worth the money. A professional chef can strip an ear of corn in a second. We non pro's do well with a tool such as this one. You also will not stab yourself with the chef knife.
customer_reviews.author: David Hall

customer_reviews.title: Score another great helper.
customer_reviews.text: If you can let the corn cool it is a near-perfect tool.Even though I did puncture my thumb it can also be used while the corn is hot.It is one on a long list of very handy,well-designed kitchen aids.I do however have issue with your veggie chopper.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: it works great. No more mess. But becareful its sharp.  Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. But becareful I did cut myself. It is very sharp. And it wasn't the products fault. It works very well. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Put up tons of corn with this one summer, kinda slow going but sharp and works well!!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley L. Medlen

customer_reviews.title: Not quite as good as a sharp knife but a whole lot easier ...
customer_reviews.text: Not quite as good as a sharp knife but a whole lot easier and neater! I automatically reach for this when I have corn. We strip it raw then sauté about 3 minutes in a tiny bit of butter &/or olive oil. Heavenly!
customer_reviews.author: Meander

customer_reviews.title: This is a great product!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about this product but I trusted the reviews and made the purchase. Boy, am I glad I did. This is a fantastic device to get the kernels off the cob. I stripped 53 cobs of corn in under 45 minutes. It would have taken me 1.5hours with a knife. And the corn mostly stayed in the unit instead of littering my counter. Buy this!
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: great convenience
customer_reviews.text: This is a great kitchen tool. Just be carefully not to cut yourself. We use the Party Time oven plastic oven gloves to hold the cob so it doesn't slip. Works great!
customer_reviews.author: Tjn

customer_reviews.title: It`s really good product to strip corns but why I give three ...
customer_reviews.text: It`s really good product to strip corns but why I give three stars is the item I ordered was Silver colored but what I got was the yellow one. But the most important point is this is made by OXO. I like it.
customer_reviews.author: betty lee

customer_reviews.title: It's really good to use, convenient, simple, helping.
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for something like this, and I think it's awesome!!! my mother used to use knife to cut the corn, and I really think it's dangerous, with this, I don't have to worry about it anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Cuilian Ding

customer_reviews.title: Not an OXO corn stripper
customer_reviews.text: I was sent some cheap imitation form China. I happened to find an OXO in a retail store and was able to compare. No OXO labeling, cheaper materials, pretty worthless
customer_reviews.author: Terry K.

customer_reviews.title: works great?
customer_reviews.text: Works wonderful. Corn comes off cob without being crushed. Only takes seconds to remove corn from cob
customer_reviews.author: vicki cohan

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing! I hate eating corn on the cob. Makes me feel like an animal, but I love how it tastes. Works awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Don Smart

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: It is ok but does not work as well as I had hoped.
customer_reviews.author: Avery N. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly useful
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item this year because last years use of the over the cob push down type cutter was such a nightmare. I can't say enough about how well this product works, it removes just the right amount of the corn, no way to get injured, easy to use, easy to clean up, someone did invent a better mouse trap.
customer_reviews.author: B. S. Young

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in OXO
customer_reviews.text: I'm sorry but I have no idea how this pitiful little gadget got any ratings above one star. It mashes the corn kernels and only cuts off the very top of each kernel. It does hold the cut pieces partially but they still end up all over the place when you try to empty them out. So much better to just use a knife. I'm disappointed in OXO for putting their name on this product.
customer_reviews.author: Kokopelli

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Not worth the money. I can do it quicker and get more of the kernel with a knife. I'd return it if I still had the box it came in
customer_reviews.author: applemc55

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: This corn stripper works great! Much better than others I tried or using a knife. I used it to strip corn for freezing and it was quick and easy.
customer_reviews.author: S. Shaw

customer_reviews.title: BIC
customer_reviews.text: This corn stripper cuts the corn off the cob quickly with very little effort. But, beware the blade is not protected. The first time I used it I stabbed my finger.
customer_reviews.author: BIC

customer_reviews.title: easy to take apart and clean up and put back ...
customer_reviews.text: works just as advertised. easy to take apart and clean up and put back together again.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Grace

customer_reviews.title: A knife works much better.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is dangerous! Cut my thumb three times on the first ear of corn. Would not buy again! A knife works much better.
customer_reviews.author: James Shearhart

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: This works great, got it for a sibling who has braces. It's kinda messy, but worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Miss. Rickard

customer_reviews.title: It is awesome, no more corn flying
customer_reviews.text: It is awesome, no more corn flying. Easy to use and clean.
customer_reviews.author: lucila

customer_reviews.title: Works well for price
customer_reviews.text: Works great but be careful - sliced finger going too fast. Did 5 dozen ears really fast. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Kossik

customer_reviews.title: It's a waste of my money and very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Not practical at all. It's a waste of my money and very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Gilkison

customer_reviews.title: ... were given TONS of corn this year and I hate it on the cob but this gadget works magic ...
customer_reviews.text: My husband works in farming and we were given TONS of corn this year and I hate it on the cob but this gadget works magic and is so easy to use!
customer_reviews.author: Jordan S.

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: This corn stripper works great, it's so much easier than cutting the corn off with a knife. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Feagans

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Takes the mess out of cutting corn kernels off the cob. Neat little "gadget"
customer_reviews.author: Irene Williams

customer_reviews.title: Worked very well
customer_reviews.text: Got this to keep the kids happy, works just like you would expect. Handy to have, looks great, works well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Must have for corn season!
customer_reviews.text: Cooks illustrated rated it the best and so do I!
customer_reviews.author: Susu

customer_reviews.title: Not very easy to use safely
customer_reviews.text: Cuts kernals in half. Not very easy to use safely.
customer_reviews.author: SGcvn69

customer_reviews.title: Great gadget!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and easy to clean up! I am not wasting corn anymore by using a knife!
customer_reviews.author: J. Loren craig

customer_reviews.title: Works great, makes stripping corn easy
customer_reviews.text: My husband has a retainer and so he can't eat corn on the cob. With this little gadget, he can enjoy grilled corn with the rest of us. This is much better than other corn strippers we've used, because it has the corn catching cup and nice wide teeth. It works well, but be careful to follow the included instructions on how to hold your corn, or you might cut yourself! A really nice, convenient product.
customer_reviews.author: Mel M

customer_reviews.title: Finding the Right Gift
customer_reviews.text: Some people prefer not to eat their corn on the cob and use a knife to remove the kernels. Finding this particular household help was a plus and worked well as a gift.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Lisiecki

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great once you get the hang of it. I use it often and love it. Good price too.
customer_reviews.author: Andre M Martineau

customer_reviews.title: Easier than knife and faster
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't get all the kernel so you still need to scrape the "cream" from the cob with back of knife. But still the best way to prep corn for freezing.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Did 60 ears of fresh corn in 35 minutes. ...
customer_reviews.text: Did 60 ears of fresh corn in 35 minutes. I ended up taking it apart to use as dumping the container became a pain.
customer_reviews.author: Shambeda

customer_reviews.title: Nice item.
customer_reviews.text: This works pretty good but it is putzy and really doesn't seem to be any better than using a knife.
customer_reviews.author: Bnksgram

customer_reviews.title: Good not great
customer_reviews.text: It cuts well (including my finger), but my complaint is that despite pushing down hard on the corn, it leaves a lot behind.
customer_reviews.author: C Hagar

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love it Easy to use. Less than 1 minute per ear of corn.....
customer_reviews.author: Joyce R. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME INVENTION
customer_reviews.text: The Oxo Good Grips Corn Stripper works very nicely. It is quick and easy to use - and cleans up very easily. I would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: JUDUDE

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great for cutting corn off the cob! Quick and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Melinda E. Smith

product_meta.title: OXO Good Grips Corn Stripper, 1, Clear/White/Black
product_meta.description: 1128000 removing corn kernels from cobs has never been easier. The OXO good grips corn stripper features a container that catches the kernels as they are stripped from the cob. Simply push the corn stripper down the length of the cob and the kernels collect in a convenient -cup Capacity container. Turn the cob and continue stripping until all kernels are removed. Kernels can be poured out of the top hole of the container into a bowl or onto a plate. The soft, non-slip grips cushion your hand during use and the stainless steel blade will not rust or dull. The corn stripper comes apart for easy cleaning and all parts are dishwasher safe. Features: -corn stripper. -Material: stainless steel. -Easily strips corn kernels off cobs. -Kernels collect in a -cup Capacity container (approximately one cob). -convenient top opening for emptying kernels. -Container separates for easy cleaning. -Stainless steel blade soft, non-slip grips. -Dishwasher safe. -Not recommended for use in microwave. -Weight: 0. 5 oz. . -Dimensions: 4. 75'' H x 2. 75'' W x 2. 50'' D.
feature_bullets: Easily strips corn kernels off cobs
Kernels collect in a 0.5-cup capacity container (approximately one cob)
Convenient top opening for emptying kernels
